reviews.review: its an amazing game, with a concept thats innovative and fun. BUT it has the same problem as alot of asymetrical games, and that is balance. the survivors have no direct counterplay, they can only run away from the killer. In said chase he has multiple ways of evading the killer, mainly dropping pallets and vaulting windows. That is were the problem lies tho, because balancing around that is hard. creating too many pallets would make survivors overpowered, spawning less makes the killer op. That creates the next problem, because certain map tiles can spawnt next to each other, in a way that makes it impossible/ very hard for the killer to catch up. the game in that sense is fundamentaly broken. the other way is possible as well, were over a huge area on the map theres just nothing for a survivor to work with. additionally to that there are killers who are overpowered (like nurse) to a point where they need a fundamental rework, and there are killers who are underpowered (like old freddy, who luckly got a rework). so overall its a good game with a amazing game concept, but is just fundamentaly broken and unbalanced

I've only been 13 hours in, but so far I have been having fun with my friends. I'd say this game is literally the most fun with friends! I really recommend this to players that want to play with friends!

although I can sometimes say that some killers are too overpowered with some of the totems they equip which makes the game kinda unfair. but so far I've been having fun!
